meanings.definition: The light reflected from the moon.
meanings.sent1: The moonlight shone through the window, casting a soft glow in the room.
meanings.sent2: She loved to walk in the moonlight, feeling the cool breeze on her face.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat chased its own shadow in the moonlight, thinking it was a clever game.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight danced on the surface of the lake, creating a mesmerizing reflection.
meanings.sent5: Under the moonlight, the trees looked like dark silhouettes against the night sky.

meanings.definition: To work at a secondary job, often at night.
meanings.sent1: After his regular job, he would moonlight as a delivery driver to earn extra money.
meanings.sent2: She decided to moonlight as a tutor to help students with their studies.
meanings.sent3: The chef would moonlight as a musician on weekends, entertaining the restaurant guests with his guitar.
meanings.sent4: He would moonlight as a security guard at the museum, ensuring the artifacts were safe at night.
meanings.sent5: To make ends meet, she would moonlight as a waitress at a local diner in the evenings.
